page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF AREA
page.content: THE LANDSCAPE OF THIS AREA VARIES WITH THE SEASONS.IN THE SPRING IT IS DOMINATED BY THE BRILLIANT YELLOW OF OIL SEED RAPE.THERE HAVE BEEN COMPLAINTS THAT TRAFFIC ACCIDENTS MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY DRIVERS BEING DAZZLED BY THE YELLOW GLARE BUT IT HAS NOT BEEN PROVED.AS THIS FADES THE COLOUR TURNS TO SHADES OF GREEN AND BROWN AS TREES BURST INTO LEAF AND CEREAL CROPS GROW AND RIPEN.THERE ARE THREE SMALL WOODS,TWO ARE PREDOMINATELY DECIDUOUS AND ONE CONIFEROUS.THEY BREAK UP THE LANDSCAPE AND PROVIDE FOOD AND SHELTER FOR SMALL BIRDS AND ANIMALS.TWO BURNS,A LOCAL WORD FOR STREAM,RUN THROUGH THE SQUARE ONE, WHITTLE BURN,HAS A BRIDLE PATH RUNNING ALONGSIDE IT CALLED WHITTLE DENE.A MAJOR TRUNK ROAD,THE A695 RUNNING FROM NEWCASTLE TO CARLISLE VIA HEXHAM TRANSECTS THE AREA.
